Fall 2013

  • Spinoza: Proposition 13, Ethics II
    In Propositions 10-13, Spinoza turns his discussion to man and his nature. The punchline is Proposition 13: the object of the idea constituting the human mind is indeed nothing but an existing body.

Spring 2013

  • [Derrida on the Possibility of Responsibility](/essays/Derrida.pdf)
